titles: An introduction to the looue of God. Accompted among the workes of S. Augustine, and translated into English, by the right reuerend father in God, Edmund, Bishop of Norvvitch, that nowe is, and by him dedicated to the Queenes most excellent Maiestie, to the glorie of God, and comfort of his chosen. And newlie turned into Englishe meter by Robert Fletcher. 1581.
author: Simard, Marie Ange, attributed name.
Freake, Edmund, ca. 1516-1591.
Fletcher, Robert, fl. 1586.
publisher: By Thomas Purfoot, and are to be solde at his shop without Newgate ouer against Saint Sepulchers Church,
notes: An adaptation in meter of: An introduction to the love of God, which is probably not, in fact, by Saint Augustine.
Appended, with caption title: A verie fruitefull prayer to God the Father, for the obtayning of these benefites, promised in this booke, and necessarie to be vsed at all tymes.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
